website_summaries.verdict: With its uniquely ornate design and extra depth, this stand and bowl will have your dog dining in style while minimizing messes at the same time.
pros: Sturdy wrought iron construction with non-slip feet stays put even when subjected to enthusiastic munching or gulping
Extra deep stainless steel bowl prevents splashes and spills
Both the stand and bowl are dishwasher safe for effortless cleaning
Rounded bowl allows flat-faced dogs to reach every last morsel
cons: Comes as a single bowl, so you'll need to purchase two for food and water

customer_reviews.title: Well made!! Great bowl.
customer_reviews.text: Size LARGE was a little larger than I expected. But it is good for a water bowl. It comfortably hold 72 oz of water (9cups). Attached is a picture of it next to a DIRTY ugly milk crate. The medium bowl holds 8 cups water and is a little shorter. See picture.
customer_reviews.author: M. Calderwood

customer_reviews.title: Cute!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! I have an American Bulldog/Pitbull mix about 80/85 lbs and bought a large. He's a little taller because of the American Bulldog half. He's coming up to 7 years old and I wanted to get him an elevated bowl since he's getting older. He was scared of it at first, but go used to it in a couple mins since his food was in there. Bowl is smaller than his original feeding bowl. Still fits his 3 scoop dinner.
customer_reviews.author: Let

customer_reviews.title: Nope.
customer_reviews.text: Large size does not match photo. Stand is cheaply made and is incorrectly listed by its Chinese manufacturer as wrought iron. This is NOT WROUGHT IRON---the ultra thin wiring is no better than rubbermade shelving that tips back and forth scaring my rescue dog while he attempted to eat from it. Returned this item for an actual wrought iron/durable stand.
customer_reviews.author: HelloKitteh

customer_reviews.title: YML 10-Inch Black Wrought Iron Stand with Single Stainless Steel Feeder Bowl REVIEW
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my German Shepard's water bowl which has worked out well for his size of being 110 lbs. Stand is sturdy with having a very nice look to it. Shepard, and I are very happy with this purchase which I can recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Smokie Mad

customer_reviews.title: Wrought Iron? SS bowels rusted on dents Thought my dogs were using them for soccer practice Nah!
customer_reviews.text: Dogs move stand around while finishing her meal. Really Annoying. Have thrown them out including the bowels. Rusted in places also. Cheap SS and dents easily. Also sorry if the 4-star 1st review influenced anyone. It's now a 1 star.
customer_reviews.author: Doabs1

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, not sturdy. Freaked my dog out
customer_reviews.text: This product is very cheaply made, is not sturdy, and has too many small openings. My dog's name tag got stuck in the stand and majorly freaked him out, he went running dragging the food stand with him and all of his food went flying everywhere! Unfortunately had to return this and am now on the hunt for a new raised feeder (something other than plastic!)
customer_reviews.author: amfrangos1

customer_reviews.title: I was disappointed to find that two of the top corners were ...
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed to find that two of the top corners were disconnected from the base, so the gown sits on an angle. Not very good quality. I have 3 large dogs and constantly have foster dogs here. I will be surprised if this lasts more than a couple weeks at this angle. Hoping for resolution from the seller. Will update
customer_reviews.author: TG

customer_reviews.title: Great product, looks nice & dogs love them!
customer_reviews.text: We love these bowls for our two German Shepherd Dogs! Very attractive and just the right height. Our dogs are large at 115 & 90 pounds each. The bowls look attractive in our kitchen and actually match the decor but more importantly provide the safe and proper height for them to eat correctly. They do not slide easily and the stainless steel coated bowls clean easily as well.
customer_reviews.author: WarriorEddieG

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use outside when we eat on the patio so the dog can eat too without having to chase her dish around on the concrete and to discourage the ants from getting in her food. Works very well. The rest of the time we use it for patio water dish. The bowl is nice and big, she's a big girl so nice that it's elevated, hasn't tipped over yet (seems pretty solid and sturdy). And it's attractive. Very happy with this product, would buy it again. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: JFE

customer_reviews.title: Not wrought iron
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice size for my Rottweiler, but it is NOT wrought iron - it is powder coated metal wire that is quite lightweight. This actually makes it easier to clean, but it will not withstand much weight or pressure being put on it. The design is cute and it fits nicely in the corner so the bowl isn't in the middle of the floor. It does not tip over even with a rambunctious eater. I don't know how long it will last, since it is not wrought iron, but it is serving its purpose for the time being.
customer_reviews.author: Foster Dog MomTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Stylish and functional
customer_reviews.text: Love these! I bought the large for my 3 boys - 50lb pitbull, 60lb black lab, and 110lb lab mix. It was a lot higher off the ground than I originally thought, but looked great and did not slide all around the floor. I'm hoping the picture shows the height of the dogs vs the size of the dish.
customer_reviews.author: Marissa

customer_reviews.title: Great for a large dog
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, I had to return this because my dog could not reach the bowl and I was very disappointed. It was my own fault it didn't work for me because I didn't really pay attention to the dimensions. The product was very pretty and very sturdy and would be perfect for a large dog. I just wish they had one much smaller, I just want a single bowl, I have a double holder but my blind dog can't seem to get the hang of eating on one side and drinking on the other.
customer_reviews.author: Joan

customer_reviews.title: Serves its purpose.
customer_reviews.text: After breaking my dog's ceramic bowl and being unable to find a replacement, I had to purchase another pedestal feeder which my vet recommends for taller dogs. This was the best option out there. The bowl is "tinny" but it still enables my dog to eat comfortably. Not crazy that it is made in China, but his food doesn't stay in it longer than 3 minutes. Also, not being ceramic means that I won't break it like his other one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: NOT PRACTICAL FOR SKITTISH OR TRUST ISSUE DOGS ~ Dog's tags may get caught!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 2 different sizes. Bowls are TOO DEEP for feeding single meals (okay if kept, TOPPED UP for water use only). IMHO, the depth of these bowls is what causes a 'design flaw', when used for food. OUR EXPERIENCE: Dog has to put head into very deep bowl for the food...dog's tags make noise, clanging against bowl and GOT CAUGHT in the iron scroll stand...dog panic'd and RAN AWAY IN FEAR WITH, IRON STAND STILL ATTACHED TO TAGS/COLLAR! This is precisely what happened to us with our 2 dogs (GSD/PYRENEES MIX 80 lbs. & CAROLINA DOG/HUSKY MIX 45 lbs.). Pretty, but...
customer_reviews.author: RumAndChupacabras

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: First I Bought this for my older ACD so he does not have to bend down to eat. The height is perfect and the stand is sturdy. Then I bought a second one for my female ACD, who usually lays down to eat. This morning I watched her take one piece of dry food to the carpet to lay down and eat. As she continued this painfully slow process to eat her breakfast, I took the bowl out of the stand to lay down and eat. I am happy I bought these stands and bowls, for one dog is was a success but not the same for the other. The stands appear to be made well.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Vendor noon- cooperative for returning; Do not recommend for large dogs
customer_reviews.text: Update: Vendor didn't include return mailing address for returning with return instructions; I've never had this occur with a return and I've ordered many many products on Amazon; I've tried contacting but no response so far; frustrated as UPS was supposed to pick it up today; Too light for large dogs; my dogs, both Goldens, do not like them. I'm returning after 2 days. One dog is scared so much that he won't eat. The other eats very warily as it wobbles on the tile.
customer_reviews.author: MauRanchGldnrtvrs

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking but bowls are flimsy
customer_reviews.text: At first I really liked these. The stands are cute and they are a nice way to keep the bowls elevated for large dogs. However after about a month and a half the bowls started to get splits in the top. 2 out of the 3 that I purchased are doing this. There are 4-5 splits now in each bowl. Luckily I got them to use with food and not water or I would have to throw them away. They are also starting to rust. These are kept indoors. I’m really disappointed and I have never seen a metal bowl do this before!
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: Good Value for the Money
customer_reviews.text: This feeder-bowl was just the right choice for my dog. I own a 2 year old Labradane who is quite tall (27") at the shoulders and this feeder-bowl stands 10" above the floor giving Jackson the advantage of not having to strain his neck and shoulders to bend down to eat his food. The bowl and stand are quality built and appears to be steady enough to last for several years. I am happy with the purchase and so is Jackson. Have a great day and may the LOVE of JESUS CHRIST richly bless you. Charles(NAHUM 1:7 / JOHN 3:16 KJV).
customer_reviews.author: Reverend Charles D. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: The only one my dog would use
customer_reviews.text: The bowl on this one is big enough to make my Labrador happy. He wouldn't eat out of the ones with smaller bowls. I am using with Gorilla Grip Original Silicone Pet Feeding Mat. The rubber mat keeps it from sliding around pretty well. It has a little bit of weight to it so stays put on the mat pretty well. The rubber mat is a bit of a hair magnet. Looks nicer than the ones that my dog rejected so I'm happy with the combination.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy H.

customer_reviews.title: The bowl split!
customer_reviews.text: We bought 2 in 2017.They held up well until now (2 1/2 years later). We wash them by hand every day...we don't subject them to extreme temps ( our rotties are house girls)...we are careful not to knock the bowls around. One of the bowls developed a 2 inch split! I didn't even know that stainless steel bowls split! Now we are looking for a replacement bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Crafty Chica T.

customer_reviews.title: Well made, bowl is huge!
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be a well made product, and is very attractive, but I got the shortest size for my 45 lb staffie and it seems like the bowl stays the same size regardless of which height you buy so the bowl seems ridiculously large for my dog’s size. Also, it did wobble a bit when I received it and I had to use a wrench to bend one of the legs a bit to get it to stop.
customer_reviews.author: JLG

customer_reviews.title: Good for water, too lightweight for food. Looks exactly as shown.
customer_reviews.text: Cute wire stands. Deep, lightweight bowl is easy to remove to clean & fill. Too lightweight for food because it moved when my dogs tried to eat. They got scared when their tags hit the side of the bowl, too, so my dogs wouldn’t eat out of them. But they will drink water out of them. Even my KiTays, who have to stretch up on kitty toes to reach the water, will take an occasional sip. They have other sources for water, or I wouldn’t have tried the raised dishes.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Finnigan

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy but it works
customer_reviews.text: We had our hardwood floors redone and needed an elevated water dish so we could see when the water was sitting on the floor. We damaged our floors by having a water dish on a mat on the wood floors. I did not notice that water was sitting under the mat. This allows me to see if water is underneath. Although it is not super sturdy... You could bend it if forced... It is level and does not knock over. Holds enough water for our 2 GSD's...I refill every a.m. and p.m.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: It's very cool looking but not functional. The bowl is too deep, no dog should be eating that much in one feeding. No other bowls will fit. I was not able to return it due to UPS.
customer_reviews.author: Debi Nolan

customer_reviews.title: Love these pretty bowls.
customer_reviews.text: We have 5 big dogs who all use these. They’re sturdy and the bowls are super deep dish and rounded. They’re way better than the basic dogs bowls. They are a little bit noisy because of the metal on metal, but 6 dogs eating at the same time will never be quiet. I do wish that there were taller sizes available because we do have extra large breed puppies that will need something taller and just as sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Winner for me!
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this elevated, elegant bowl! If her dog bowl was on the ground, she was known to bury her food-sometimes making a mess! Since purchasing this, she doesn't exhibit that behavior any longer. I have to set it on a grip though, since it would slide on any smooth surface and I have it on tile. But it's cute and constructed well. The bowl is big and holds a lot of food! Definitely a winner for me!
customer_reviews.author: deb1210

customer_reviews.title: Big disappointment!!!
customer_reviews.text: Sorry, folks, but this item was a total surprise and disappointment! It is NOT wrought iron, as stated in the description, but rather is just a light-weight black coated metal like what is used for small yard decorations. Also, it DOES slip and is VERY easily knocked over, contrary to the description. It's tall and flimsy. I don't know how this is getting any good reviews as it is so not what was described. Very disappointing. I returned it immediately.
customer_reviews.author: J K - Nashville, TN

customer_reviews.title: I love it so far
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised I really like this. I read some reviews they're wrong it's not flimsy. it's thicker than my other wire holder. it's great for a water bowl. I don't see how a dog could have gotten their tags caught on it. I haven't fed them out of it so I don't know if it will move around, I know my other wire dish does. I had to weigh it down with wrist weights. I bought a 2nd one.
customer_reviews.author: dustyiron

customer_reviews.title: NOT DURABLE BOWLS
customer_reviews.text: I just bought two sets of these bowls for my german shepherds in April 2020 and the bowls have started to literally tear apart. My dogs do not chew their metal bowls so I have no idea how this could have happened in such a short time. I am very disappointed that a plastic bowl I use to feed them for years have outlasted these metal bowls I have just had for 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: Ajaxious

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Medium to Large Dogs
customer_reviews.text: I love this feeder bowl. It's 10.5" tall and is perfect my medium-sized dog. The bowl that comes with this feeder is really nice. Told my hubby that I wanted the bowl for use in the kitchen and he laughed. I kid you not, it's really a nice bowl and the stand is cute and very sturdy. I love the bone shapes that are part of the wrought iron stand. You can't go wrong with this.
customer_reviews.author: Janice L TolerTop Contributor: Children's Books

customer_reviews.title: Great dish!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a second water dish for my blue heeler mix. It’s very pretty, great height for my doggo and holds plenty of water! My dog recently got diagnosed with an autoimmune disease and is on medication that makes her really thirsty! This is perfect size so I’m not constantly refilling!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Rusting after 6 days
customer_reviews.text: Received this set on Monday. The black metal holder is slightly lopsided, but cute enough to look past the slight imperfection. Today, after no even a full week of use - i noticed rust spots in the bowl. extremely disappointed !
customer_reviews.author: dana

customer_reviews.title: Bowl's Metal Full of Cracks (again).
customer_reviews.text: 8/24/19: One stainless steel bowls has developed stress fractures which radiate 2-3" into the bowl. I'm attempting to replace the bowl. 2/15/20: It's happened again - another one of the replacement bowls has cracks all around the rim and we'll be tossing it and looking for another bowl to fit the feeders. The feeders are holding up well and are attractive.
customer_reviews.author: Greenback, TN Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my 70lb Boxer
customer_reviews.text: this thing works great for me! My boxer, River is 5+ now, really did need a raised bowl. However, Willis, my Corgi, did not. This singular stand works perfect for my house. Its not huge and ugly, the black metal simply 'hides' on the boot tray that holds all 3 bowls. I wrapped small pieces of black electrical tape on 4 sides. This allows me to put River's existing raised bottom Kong bowl right onto the stand. It does come with a nice, stainless steel bowl. That bowl is the new water bowl over at the folks house now. I also liked the decorative bones on the side of the stand. And the price was right.
customer_reviews.author: FrischInKs

customer_reviews.title: great water dish for big dog!
customer_reviews.text: Love this water dish for my Rott. She doesn't have to lean over to drink. Its plenty sturdy and the water bowl is HUGE. I tried to use it to feed her ... ehh NOT. It's definitely not sturdy enough with just dog food in it. She pushed it all around and tipped it over. Very nice bowl and decorative base, definitely recommend for water.
customer_reviews.author: Nature Girl

customer_reviews.title: Looks very nice
customer_reviews.text: I love that you can buy these individually which makes cleaning easier than having food and water bowls together. My dog is a messy eater and drinker. With these being separate, I don’t have to worry about food getting in water or vice verse. These are not what I’d call elegant, but definitely classier than most.
customer_reviews.author: GAKABZ

customer_reviews.title: Used it for a hummingbird bath
customer_reviews.text: We used this as a base for a YouTube DIY hummingbird bath and it worked perfectly for the water bowl and base. We fit a standard plastic plate on top and made holes in it and inserted a tube attached to a tiny water pump. It's durable and is easy to clean. The hummingbirds like to drink from it too.
customer_reviews.author: lani girl*

customer_reviews.title: Bowl split!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have never seen a metal bowl split but this one did and is now useless. So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Deeda

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking but has design flaw.
customer_reviews.text: I like the look and quality of this stand. The problem is that the gaps in the metal catch on my dogs ID tag. I’ve had to untangle her collar from it several times. I’m afraid she’s going to get hurt if no one is around. Too bad because it’s a cute little stand.
customer_reviews.author: Lorrel

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and decorative
customer_reviews.text: Originally ordered to elevate dog's water bowl to make it easier on his digestive system. Unknown perks, less mess, water is not slopped all over the floor, it's the perfect height for dog approx 20' tall and it is definitely sturdier than I anticipated by the picture.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: We got these bowls for both our pups (one is a Bernese Mountain Dog, 125lbs, and one is a German Shepherd mix 75lbs) the large is tall enough that they don't have to strain their necks when eating. The bowls fit perfectly and there was no sticker in the bowl (lots of reviews complained about that) the sticker was on the bottom. Bowls are nice and deep and very easy to clean. The are aesthetically pleasing. Great buy for the price. Purchased about a month ago.
customer_reviews.author: Tlay

customer_reviews.title: I keep the water dish in the bathroom, as it gets knocked into beng in the kitchen & spills.
customer_reviews.text: Elegant for my kitchen & perect height for my German Shepherd Chloe. The price was affordable & the dish itself is well made quality. No reason to pay twice te cost, very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Janice

customer_reviews.title: Overall, its a good product.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these, one for water and one for food. Overall, it is a good product, I have a 50 lbs. Husky and a 60 lbs. German Shepard mix and the height seems to work for both dogs. As far as aesthetics, it is a nice looking dog bowl for the price. My only complaint would be that each bowl had circular marks inside the bowl and scratches on the outer rim of each bowl. I was not sure if the circular marks on the inside of the bowl were part of the design or not. I did not see them in some of the pictures other people posted.
customer_reviews.author: Chibichan

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: The stand is quite sturdy, and the bowl holds a LOT of water..... enough to pretty much last my Doberman and my Lab all day long. However, the bowl itself is a little on the flimsy side, but works fine. Also, they should put the UPC sticker on the OUTSIDE of the bowl, and not the inside. Had to soak it for quite a while to get the label/glue off the bottom of the inside of the bowl. Serves its purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Tropical BreezeTop Contributor: Nail Polish

customer_reviews.title: Labrador approved!
customer_reviews.text: We have an 86 lb Labrador with arthritis and joint issues. We had another raised dish but it was ceramic and broke. needed something to replace it with. This is a great height for him. He doesn't have to strain his neck to eat. The stand sits on a rug. Doesn't move to much. It is a deep dish he eats like 2 cups of food so plenty of room! Came packaged well in the box.
customer_reviews.author: P. Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Large is a good size for larger dogs
customer_reviews.text: I was using a milk crate for the longest time lol. Finally got around getting my dog this. Its a good height for a 4yr old 80lb pibble. This is a LARGE size. The bowl is a little bigger than expected but thats a good thing. First order i got was defective and got a replacement quickly.
customer_reviews.author: omrawr

customer_reviews.title: Wrought iron??? Nope
customer_reviews.text: Wrought Iron??? This is a skinny metal. Something like a wire hanger except harder. I thought the metal would be thicker to be considered wrought iron. They are cute but did not meet my expectations of being heavy duty wrought iron and not for $20 a piece.
customer_reviews.author: brandie cusack

customer_reviews.title: Great dishes with beautiful stands.
customer_reviews.text: I like how nice these bowls look. I really didn't like how the plastic stands looked. These are the perfect height for my goldendoodle. Also, she is a sloopy drinker so I like that they are separate pieces. I can space them apart. No more mushy kibble. Also, the bowls are large.
customer_reviews.author: denise ogara

customer_reviews.title: Not very heavy!
customer_reviews.text: This is attractive and a good height, but the metal frame is not at all heavy and it must be put on a rubber mat or other non-slip surface (not just a folded dishtowel) as the whole things move easily while the dog is drinking or any small bump will move it. The description of "wrought iron" made me think that it is heavy. It is not going to work for my two big dogs as their water dish, unless I can get it stationary.
customer_reviews.author: K. McRitchie

customer_reviews.title: Maybe would be food for smaller dogs? Mine are 110 pounds each.
customer_reviews.text: I didnt like that it moves all over the place when the dogs eat and it tipped over a few times too. It looks pretty, but I'm not using it anymore.
customer_reviews.author: D. Miller

customer_reviews.title: My dog would not go near this for a week
customer_reviews.text: I'm assuming the cheap Chinese stainless bowl emitted some kind of odor he could detect that I could not. Even after several dishwasher cycles, my dog went on a hunger strike before he would go near this bowl. He started eating immediately and normally again when I reverted to his old bowl.
customer_reviews.author: B. R.

customer_reviews.title: Its okay
customer_reviews.text: Bowl is very nice but it is not that sturdy. I have an American Bulldog puppy who is just 4 months old and he moves this bowl all around. My grown American Bulldog can easily move it across the room. I got the size large bowl which is great for their size just isn't very strong and sturdy. I will probably put some grippers on the bottom and see if that helps.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Great For My Huge (but Timid) Dog
customer_reviews.text: I've had to get rid of dog bowls before because they would rattle too much and my 100+ Pyrenees/Lab mix would get to scared to eat. I was nervous buying this in case it wasn't sturdy enough, but it's the perfect height for her and after she built up the courage to eat out of it the first time, she hasn't questioned it since. I highly recommend this bowl for big dog owners!
customer_reviews.author: Faith Thornton

customer_reviews.title: Pretty and useful!  A perfect match!
customer_reviews.text: This stand is perfect for our Elkhound husky mix. We had been using a milk crate, which I hated but my husband liked. This was the perfect solution to the ugly factor! This was inexpensive, pretty and had held up well over the last 7 konths! I really like how easy it is to clean as well. I’m back here today to buy another one for his food bowl!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great water bowl
customer_reviews.text: Live this water bowl!! Purchased this for our 1 year old border collie who always wants to dig in her water bowl. This keeps her water clean and prevents her from digging and splashing water everywhere. Plus it looks great. We get lots of compliments on the bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Ward

customer_reviews.title: Veterinary suggested this bowl
customer_reviews.text: My 10 week old Siberian husky puppy always keeps neck inside the water bowl while sleeping, which made his neck part yellow. Veterinary doctor suggested me to get this bowl since it’s 10” above the ground. Now he sleeps on his bed! I’m glad I bought this elevated bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Vegito_Blue

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Addition to my Screened Porch
customer_reviews.text: This dish is the watering hole of choice for my Australian Cattle Dog. Not only is Mavis a sloppy drinker, she spends most of her day in and out of the doggie door from the porch to the backyard. Even if we're in the house, she'll go out and drink from this dish rather than the one in the kitchen. I think her genetic memory preferes a fresh-water pond.
customer_reviews.author: J. Forte

customer_reviews.title: Great solution!
customer_reviews.text: Would definitely recommend! I bought this for our old Weimaraner girl who needed a little help to not lean down so much to eat. She's not the most graceful and has bumped it a few times when eating and it has never tipped over. I did place a little rug under it to help with any sliding on our wood floor, but that might be because of her pushing on it. It has a very large bowl that is perfect for her and simple to toss in the dishwasher. After she got used to it over a couple of days, she didn't hesitate any longer to eat from it. Would buy again if needed because of price and usefulness.
customer_reviews.author: Lan

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with quality
customer_reviews.text: My Doberman is about 5 and I thought it was time to elevate his food. I have been doing it for my 6 yo because she had major surgery on both her hind legs when she was one. The metal base is sturdy, the metal bowl is a thinner metal than my other metal bowls, but they are 20 years old and probably thicker than current ones being sold. My dogs don’t chew their bowls so I am pleased with it so far. I am pleased with it!
customer_reviews.author: IK

customer_reviews.title: the bowls and stands are the perfect height for my English Bulldog
customer_reviews.text: The only reason this is getting a 4 and not a 5 is because it took over two weeks of scrubbing and washing to get the glue from the tag removed from the inside of the bowl. That is some tough glue! Manufacture might want to think about placing the tag on the outside and bottom of the bowl instead of the inside of the bowl. Other than that...the bowls and stands are the perfect height for my English Bulldog. We bought two...after dealing with a raised double feeder, I got tired of cleaning his food out of his water dish. Now that is not a problem since they stand individually.
customer_reviews.author: 8ulldogmama

customer_reviews.title: Got dented, discolored bowls first. Returned and new ones are good.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived defective. The bowl was dented in two places, which I could live with. However, there was also some discoloration that looks like paint splatter in the bowl that I couldn't get off easily. So returned for a replacement and we'll see how the next one looks. Hopefully it works out, because size/height are good and seems relatively sturdy for the price. Updated: Replacement bowl were good, not dented and not discolored. So, all in all happy! Upgraded to 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Maximum

customer_reviews.title: Perfect standing bowl
customer_reviews.text: I have an older malinois who refuses to eat if her bowl is on the ground I used to have her bowl ontop of a bin but wanted something better looking. She loves it and I love it! It looks great in the room. The bowl its self it huge but the height is just right. I love how sturdy it is compaired to similiar products
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: This bowl is not large enough for 2 big dogs so I modified it by using a larger dish on top of the stand. Seems to work well & it’s cute. I like the concept of a raised dish for senior dogs & my GSD doesn’t stick her foot in the water anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Second time purchaser

customer_reviews.title: Great bowl
customer_reviews.text: Great bowl... My dog is on the large size and still growing. I had this bowl for her food dish and decided that I needed to add it for her water and am glad I did. Before when she would drink I'd have mop the floor because of the amount of water she would splash out. this doesn't happen with this bowl. All the splashing stays in the bowl and Baby said that it was a lot easier for her to drink from.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Sitek

customer_reviews.title: I love them so much
customer_reviews.text: OMG!!! These bowls are absolutely darling. I love them so much. My German Shepherds love them too. They are really huge, I could not believe it. They dont slide all over the place either while my kids are eating their food. I would highly recommend these to anyone that has a big dog/s. It is so much better for big dogs to not have to bend their heads so far down to the floor while eating. These are life savers for big dogs. Highly recommended. I will be buying more.
customer_reviews.author: jaguar

customer_reviews.title: They elevate the food for your dog...
customer_reviews.text: I used this product to elevate my American Bulldogs food and water bowls...Plus sometimes when he throws a hissy fit he likes to bat his bowls around the kitchen...But I actually anchored them to a 2X8 Stacked on a 2X8...So now he can't move anything...This is my second order.. I think they work really well for me....Well made....
customer_reviews.author: john w. haggerty

customer_reviews.title: After some getting used to my dog loves this
customer_reviews.text: I have a 60lb hound/boxer mix and purchased the large (10in). We have a separate self-refilling water bowl that the dog and cats share so I only bought one for her kibble. The bowl is VERY shiny and makes a slight clanging noise against the metal frame as she eats so she was a little nervous at first. But she is a sissy who takes time to get used to everything so that wasn't too surprising to me. After a week or so she is now fine with the bowl and happily eats her meals without having to crouch/hunch down! Perfect height for her.
customer_reviews.author: KWel

customer_reviews.title: Medium for food bowl; Large for water bowl.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two larges for my dogs. (German Shepherd Mix and a Boxer/Lab Mix) I would say if you are using for water get a large, but if you are using to feed get a medium. My dogs eat two cups in the morning and at night and the large is a bit too big. However, it’s a great product and it doesn’t really matter how big the bowl is as long as there is food in it! I would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: JMG229

customer_reviews.title: Deep enough and tall enough for a Dane!
customer_reviews.text: I have a Great Dane/mastiff and I’ve been searching high and low for something deep enough for his water bowl and this product is PERFECT. I got the Large size and I’m so happy I went with my gut. It’s sturdy, and came put together already so I had no hassle with trying to build it myself or anything. I only bought one the first time just in case I didn’t like it but I instantly bought another one as soon as I put it down and filled it with water. It’s tall enough for my Dane, and deep enough that I don’t have to refill it every 5 minutes. LOVE it!
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Good dog bowl
customer_reviews.text: I needed an elevated water bowl for my medium-sized poodle mix, but this bowl is too large and too high for him. I am returning it. It would be good as a water or food bowl for a large dog as it does hold a lot. It is well-made and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Eldean

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for 80 lb. Chessie
customer_reviews.text: This water bowl is great for our big boy and our 30 lb. little girl has no trouble with it. They immediately began drinking from it. It is cute and quite sturdy as well as safer for their necks.
customer_reviews.author: DonnaSConnelly

customer_reviews.title: Awesome and great price
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 of these and picked up these replacement bowls, which fit perfectly:  This is a great product for a great price.

customer_reviews.title: No more wet floors!
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 dogs - alab/rescue mix and a 10-month-old Sheltid puppy. When the water bowl was on the floor, the puppy was constantly playing in the water. She now drinks from the bowl rather than playing in it. Best thing I brought for her yet.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Duck

customer_reviews.title: RUST INSIDE BOTTOM OF BOWL—IN LESS THAN 1 WEEK!!!
customer_reviews.text: Like the stand & my tall/leggy Treeing Walker Coonhounds like the water bowl raised... HOWEVER...THE BOWL GOT RUST INSIDE THE BOTTOM OF IT—AFTER LESS THAN 1 WEEK OF USE!!! Do not buy unless you are planning on finding another bowl to go inside it. See photo—rust spot circled in red.
customer_reviews.author: Jill M.

customer_reviews.title: NOT WROUGHT IRON
customer_reviews.text: This product is not wrought iron. It is powder coated bent metal wire. Very light weight. My 80 pound mut hasn't knocked it over yet. It holds enough food for one of his daily meals. I don't know how long the powder coat will last on concrete. If it had truly been wrought iron could have wire brushed and repainted any rust spots. Time will tell on this one. I will update my review after I have had more time to test out
customer_reviews.author: Richard Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Almost solved the problem
customer_reviews.text: My golden doodle is a messy messy eater and drinker. Since getting these I seldom have to wipe up water; still picking up food, but way way less than before. Not to mention they are absolutely beautiful and the pans that come with them are very sturdy. Would recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: janices

customer_reviews.title: Great bowls for our pitbull mixes
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 of these for our 2 pitbull mixes. I absolutely love these. I ordered 2 for food and 1 for water. They are a nice height for the dogs who weigh 75 to 85 lbs. They are also sturdy and dont tip or move easily. I would highly recommend and the price is perfect for my budget.
customer_reviews.author: Terri Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Works with trick:
customer_reviews.text: These are great, BUT THE BOWL IS NOT MADE IN USA. VETS WILL TELL YOU...China laws for pet products are not as pure as USA. RESOLUTION: Get a smaller bowl that IS MADE IN USA and place dog food in it. Please that bowl in product bowl. Works. And is now safe.
customer_reviews.author: ADB

customer_reviews.title: Best Thing
customer_reviews.text: Bought 7. Three for food & four as water dishes (2 inside & 2 outside). Older dog was having problems swallowing; trachea collapsing. This has helped so much. I'm happy when 18 year old pitbull Miss Georgia is happy. She loved 3 meals a day & lots of cold water.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Ridley

customer_reviews.title: A MUST HAVE
customer_reviews.text: I love this bowl. My dog can still eat, probably a little more comfortably, and he can NOT throw the bowl around and get his food everywhere. This bowl has saved a lot if time, money, and effort.
customer_reviews.author: wendy collins

customer_reviews.title: The stand itself is wonderful, and the bowl is of good size
customer_reviews.text: The stand itself is wonderful, and the bowl is of good size. My 60 lb bull terrier has been drinking a lot of water lately with the heat increase in our area, and this helps make sure she never runs out and doesnt have to bend her neck to reach the water. My only complaint is that the bowl came with stickers placed on the inside of the bowl leaving a residue that was hard to remove when these stickers could have easily been placed elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Overgirl830

customer_reviews.title: Perfect water bowl!
customer_reviews.text: The feet were a little bent but easily leveled out. The dish is nice and deep! I was having puppy splashing problems. Raising and increasing the size of bowl did the trick nicely. Now the dogs can share without a fuss.
customer_reviews.author: brad knotts

customer_reviews.title: Loki and Thor approve
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this bowl for our border collie/German Shepherd mix (60 lbs) named Loki. It is very stable and does not tip over easily, even when Loki decides to shift it all over the kitchen tile. It is a very nice height but can be reached by low-to-the-ground determined pups. Loki’s brother, Thor, a corgi/Rottweiler (40 lbs) mix can reach it just fine. He checks the bowl everyday after Loki is done eating for “quality control” purposes, of course. Overall I would definitely recommend this to anyone with a taller pup.
customer_reviews.author: bleibelle

customer_reviews.title: Stainless bowl not holding up
customer_reviews.text: Really wanted to love these bowls. Used a similar product when we lived in Texas but ordered these when we moved to NH. Order 4 - one for food for each dog and one as the water bowl. Started using them in April (6 months ago) and now 3 of the 4 bowls have areas where the stainless has split. One bowl is split it 4 places. Going to have to trash them and will order different bowls.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Collins

customer_reviews.title: This is round metal wiring not wrought iron.
customer_reviews.text: This is NOT wrought iron, it is plastic coated round metal. Like closet maid racking. It is still ok and great for the price, they just need to change the name. I plan on spray painting it to look like hammered metal instead.
customer_reviews.author: MoparOrNoCar

customer_reviews.title: Nice Stable Stand
customer_reviews.text: Love this wrought iron stand. I wish I would have seen this before. I have two other stands of another brand that can be easily knocked over even when on a pad, when bumped. Since the dog dishes I use are ceramic, they usually break on my tile floor. I prefer to use ceramic food dishes. With this stand, I set the ceramic dish inside the stainless dish that comes with the stand. It works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: S. CharmianTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Cheap! Very Cheap!!
customer_reviews.text: Took the item from the packaging and the base wire frame was bent and uneven when placed on the floor. This is not as described and was sent back the same day I received it
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Great Item
customer_reviews.text: No this is not real rod iron, but I did not think it would be. It is very sturdy for our Great Prynesse who is 120 pounds. It also looks very nice. Great deal for under $20.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannine Downer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our large dog!
customer_reviews.text: Our dog is about 140 lbs and this was the perfect set up for him.... also for our cat. Ha! We had bowls on the ground but he makes such a mess that the food would get under the bowls and cause a huge mess. These work great for him because they're higher but also deeper.
customer_reviews.author: Junell

customer_reviews.title: The correct size for my dog
customer_reviews.text: The is the needed size for my dog. The issue I ran into was that his tags/collar hang down while eating and become caught on the metal stand causing him to jerk up and flip the bowl of food all over the place. By the second or third time he would eat from it.
customer_reviews.author: Rich H.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty And Practical
customer_reviews.text: This came slightly bent, I straightened it out myself by hand. ( I'm average strong ) I truly love this bowl! It's nice and big, with plenty of room for the pup to get food easily. This bowl is actually deep enough to be a water bowl. I have a little dog too,cat sized, so the taller dish, keeps the big girl at a nice angle and the little one out of her bowl. ( little pup has food allergies ). For reference the water dispenser is a 5 gallon capacity. The bowl is 9 inches in diameter, and the dog is 65Lbs. Hope pics help!
customer_reviews.author: Vdubb

customer_reviews.title: Marvin and Burley give it 5 out of 5 barks
customer_reviews.text: My boys, two bigs labs needed something to raise the food up off the ground. I had been looking for a while and found these on Amazon and they are perfect. It was hard to tell in the ad if the bowl was big enough, but it is. Marvin and Burley appreciate it as well.
customer_reviews.author: Angus

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my oldest dog.
customer_reviews.text: When you're 15 1/2 years old and need a little help to make it easier to reach your food bowl. Perfect! She is now the Queen at her throne. I love it, and more importantly, she does! Very affordable, well made, and totally worth it for my former World Champion!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stylish and makes eating easier on dog
customer_reviews.text: These are stylish bowls that will look cute in your kitchen. Our dog is pretty tall (lab) and she had to bend down to eat. The height on these bowls make eating and drinking much more comfortable for her. I got a mat to put under the bowls to minimize any sliding while she ate and to protect our floor.
customer_reviews.author: SusanS

customer_reviews.title: Check the height with your pups. But very sturdy and well made.... looks fancy!
customer_reviews.text: Measure well, I didn't and this was too tall for one of my pups. However, I turned it upside down and it was a good height. Just check your little ones reach. We have 4 dogs and I tried to get something for all. It worked, with some upside down thinking.
customer_reviews.author: StevenDR.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect For Food
customer_reviews.text: I was afraid my big cane corso would knock this thing over, but he hasn't once! It does slide around a little since I have hardwood floors, but its not too bad. I definitely recommend it for a larger dog that needs some extra food bowl height! We use it to feed three times a day, and it holds up great. As for a water bowl though, I wouldn't recommend it. My cane corso drinks large quantities of water, and that bowl would be empty in a day.
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up
customer_reviews.text: St. Bernard Mom who was in need of a tall food dish for my puppy, this was perfect!! He’s 18 months old now and it’s still absolutely perfect! His big sister (6yr old St. Bernard) has one as well and it’s great!
customer_reviews.author: Krystal

customer_reviews.title: Not even close to wrought iron and the bowl is rusting after just a couple months
customer_reviews.text: Not wrought iron and the “stainless steel” bowl is rusting after just a couple months. I was so excited for this stand to arrive, and was disappointed when instead of wrought iron it was just made of thin plastic coated metal that doesn’t even look wrought iron. Now that the bowl is rusting, I completely regret this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: DN

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed...
customer_reviews.text: ...to raise my 75-lb. dog's water bowl so make it easier for her to drink without having to bend so far down. The accompanying bowl is shiny and easy to clean, and the stand seems sturdy and durable. Happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: M. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Raised Dog Dish
customer_reviews.text: Ordered two raised dog dishes. One came without the dish. Other than that it was perfect. The dog just has to use his imagination and pretend there is a bowl there. No problem, he's an abstract thinker. The person packing the box must have been tired. There were only two items to put in.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Michaels

product_meta.title: YML 10-Inch Black Wrought Iron Stand with Single Stainless Steel Feeder Bowl
product_meta.description: Size:Large (10" H x 10.5" W x 10.5" D)10" wrought iron stand with single stainless steel feeder bowl in Black stand with bone design. Capacity of the bowl is 2.5L.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars1,733 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
